abstract: Its search engine now in the hands of Microsoft, Yahoo plans to focus on display ads, content and mobile services.
snippet: Its search engine now in the hands of Microsoft, Yahoo plans to focus on display ads, content and mobile services.
lead_paragraph: SUNNYVALE, Calif.  Carol A. Bartz, chief executive of Yahoo, has been hobbled.

headline.main: Out of Search Business, Yahoo Shifts Its Focus
headline.print_headline: Out of Search Business, Yahoo Shifts Its Focus

byline.original: By Brad Stone and Ashlee Vance

abstract: The resignation of Eric E. Schmidt was described as a mutual decision. Regulators say they are still investigating a board overlap between the companies.
snippet: The resignation of Eric E. Schmidt was described as a mutual decision. Regulators say they are still investigating a board overlap between the companies.
lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO  The alliance between Apple and Google, two Silicon Valley giants with a powerful common enemy in Microsoft, is now clearly fraying.

headline.main: Google Chief Gives Up Board Seat at Apple
headline.print_headline: Google Chief Gives Up Board Seat At Apple

abstract: Yahoo’s pact with Microsoft “is a reasonably good deal for Yahoo shareholders — but that is rather like valuing a Picasso on the cost of the canvas and the paint,” analysts at Bernstein Research wrote Monday.
snippet: Yahoo’s pact with Microsoft “is a reasonably good deal for Yahoo shareholders — but that is rather like valuing a Picasso on the cost of the canvas and the paint,” analysts at Bernstein Research wrote Monday.
lead_paragraph: Lots of people have weighed in on Yahoo‘s long-awaited search deal with Microsoft, but we thought Jeffrey Lindsay’s take was especially poetic.

abstract: Carl C. Icahn, who sharply criticized Yahoo a year ago for rejecting Microsoft’s advances, told BusinessWeek that he supported last week’s Web search deal between the two technology companies.
snippet: Carl C. Icahn, who sharply criticized Yahoo a year ago for rejecting Microsoft’s advances, told BusinessWeek that he supported last week’s Web search deal between the two technology companies.
lead_paragraph: There seems to be at least one investor who is happy with Yahoo’s decision last week to enter into a 10-year Web search deal with Microsoft: Carl C. Icahn.

headline.main: Icahn Gives Thumbs Up to Yahoo-Microsoft Deal
